Description: Body sherd of East Greek pottery plate; dull beige slip. On rim band of tongues (one in added red); at edge of floor wide black band with added red band; angular pattern and lotus bud preserved in frieze on floor; exterior: five brown bands preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.508)
